column4: HUGE PROBLEM. Ok, so I did this http://www.cyberciti.biz/faq/block-ssh-attacks-with-denyhosts/ and I blocked all hosts from connecting via ssh. What can I do?
I added my host to the allowed hosts, but I blocked all hosts, thinking that mine would be the exception

Nicke: Please don't ask to ask a question, simply ask the question (all on ONE line and in the channel, so that others can read and follow it easily). If anyone knows the answer they will most likely reply. :-)
any way I could "hack" my own server ?
Err, do you know security flaws of your server? Otherwise. It should be fine, if set up properly.
Well, I am running ircd on it, and thats it
also a torrent server, and a website
If problems come up, you'll know how to fix it. (That is if you find the source of the problem).
nothing else I can do to get into it? (its running debian, btw, but I thought this would be the best place to come)
I doubt you understand. I want to hack my own server because I blocked all SSH connections.
Okay.    I like to use ISPConfig3 for my productional server.
